xocs:funding-list.xocs:funding-text: We are grateful to Mr. Sonthaya Jampanin for donation of the specimens of M. (P.) tenasserimensis and to Dr. Roy A. Norton (SUNY, College of Environmental Sciences and Forestry) and Dr. Sandor Mahunka (Hungarian Natural History Museum) for providing literature. We also thank Dr. Robert Butcher and Associate Professor Chariya Lekprayoon (Chulalongkorn University) for reviews and comments on the manuscript. This study was supported by the Center of Excellence in Biodiversity, Chulalongkorn University. Additional support in field collecting was provided by the Plant Genetic Conservation Project at Srinakarin Dam.

head.citation-title: Two new species of the oribatid mite subgenus Phyllolohmannia (Oribatida: Lohmanniidae: Mixacarus) from Thailand
head.abstracts: Two new species of oribatid mite subgenus Phyllolohmannia of Mixacarus (Acari: Oribatida: Lohmanniidae), Mixacarus (Phyllolohmannia) tenasserimensis n. sp. and Mixacarus (P.) variata n. sp., are described and illustrated from Thailand based on adult and immature instars collected from the leaf-litter of dry evergreen forests. An identification key to six recognized species of the subgenus Phyllolohmannia is also presented. © 2011 Copyright Taylor and Francis Group, LLC.
